Intermittent theme manager failing spec might be caused due to timing of
the theme activation

column1: -> coffescript  = "fix(config): Apply config change from Atom
column2:
process locking

Summary:
https://github.com/atom/atom/commit/d1c44dcb54994eb733eff0bfde69c8454aeff22c

Also lock config across processes to prevent the user from being logged out when the main process reads config before it's finished writing. This is what is causing the login window to appear.

Test Plan: Rapidly tap between the two display modes. Note that it no longer reverts to the wrong one intermittently.

Reviewers: evan

Reviewed By: evan

Differential Revision: https://phab.nylas.com/D1931"
column4: the main process reads config before it's finished writing.

column8: On Android, sometime we can't get the first frame, which would cause intermittent fail. See bug1546128;On Windows, sometime we would get incorrect text color rendering, which would also cause intermittent fail. See bug1546133.

column6: Anchor clicks are only handled if we have a pres-context, and we may not have one yet by the time this runs, and getBoundingClientRect() won't construct it after bug 1440537. So we may need to wait a few frames to make this reliable.

column4: Previously we would wait for one async frame and some more time to ensure we have received the local times on main thread. This can be flaky.
column9: Instead wait until local time is no longer null which means worklet has produced at least one frame and that frame has been synced with main.

column1: Fix flaky EditableSelector e2e test: add more  async/await

Fix/datepicker onchange (#1631)

* test(DatePicker): remove `beforeEach`

and be explicit about onChange spy

* test(DatePicker): move some test cases under describes

just to organize tests better

* test(DatePicker): refactor `placeholder` tests

* test(DatePicker): refactor readonly & locale tests

* fix(DatePicker): mingle only with date and not time

by default react-daypicker resets the time of given value
this is undesirable and unexpected. this commit fixes so that only year,
month and day could be adjusted by datepicker leaving time part alone

* test(DatePicker): use explicit timezone in test

otherwise different environment will interpret it differently and thus
test becomes flaky
column3: Flakiness due to default timezone difference depending on platform
